$interpreted: Morris: You seem to have enjoyed life quite a bit these past years.
Morris: What are you staring at? I'm not looking for you! Move, or die!
Morris: I'm sick of you meddling brutes. I'll rip your heart right out of your body!
Morris: Where you running to?
Morris: What do you think you're doing...you discordant runt!
Morris: Enough!
Morris: ...Ambush...you treacherous scum. Creating you was those geezers' greatest mistake...
Charle: Made it just in time!
Morris: Ceres? What are you doing here?
Charle: Miss Balzac notified me.
Morris: ...Who?
Charle: You can pick that brain of yours later. Now is the time to focus!
Morris: That meddling monkey brain...
Charle: Don't say that. Barbara is a good child.
Charle: Nevertheless, I didn't know you were this stubborn. Even in such dire straits, you still want to handle it all by yourself.
Morris: It's none of your business...
Charle: These creatures were the result of failed Life Magic experiments in the past. Since they were difficult to deal with, they were sealed off here.
Charle: However, it has been so long. That's why the seal was easily broken.
Morris: You knew about this?
Charle: With a history this long, the Academy is bound to have lots of secrets. Most of them can be found in the library, silently collecting dust...
Charle: ...but I believe you're well aware of my interests.
Morris: Ceres the Nerd...
Charle: I knew this had something to do with the tales I'd read about. On top of that, I also knew that as the representative of Life Magic, you'd come running...
Charle: And that you'd consider this your responsibility and try to take it on all by yourself.
Morris: This concerns Life Magic, it's none of your business!
Charle: I get it. But if you want to seal it off again, you'll need this.
Morris: This is...
Charle: I used your Rune writing as a reference and improved yesterday's device. It's very stable now; should come in handy for the reseal.
Morris: How do you know this will work? If, like yesterday, it's just a piece of crap...
Charle: Trust me, Dietrich.
Charle: This is the product of all my technical expertise, after all.
Morris: ...Hmph. If it doesn't work, I'm trashing it.
Charle: This...is not a resealing, is it? What did you do?
Morris: You think you had it all figured out?
Morris: I'll tell you. What those old geezers couldn't do, I, the genius Morris Dietrich, can!
Morris: I always knew that those old geezers used research as a cover, wasted their time playing around with souls and tossed them aside when they failed.
Morris: They have absolutely no dignity as scholars of Life Magic.
Charle: Yes...in all honesty, these strange plants are also victims.
Morris: No skit. I've already improved the old Runes from back then a long time ago. All I needed was stable energy, then I'd be able to liberate them...
Morris: I don't owe anyone any favors, and they're no exception.
Charle: Dietrich...
Morris: That's the way it is. Get going!
Morris: Wait a second. That Crystal of yours seems a bit familiar.
Charle: Oh, yes! It's the one from your office. Not very careful of you to leave such an important material on your desk.
Morris: Bastard! Who let you inside! HEY! Stand still, Ceres!

Where you running to?
What do you think you're doing...you discordant runt!
Enough!

That's the way it is. Get going!
Wait a second. That Crystal of yours seems a bit familiar.
Oh, yes! It's the one from your office. Not very careful of you to leave such an important material on your desk.
